intro: Hieracium phaedrochloum, commonly known as the paleleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically showy blooms. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that are usually lance-shaped and can vary in color from green to reddish. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium phaedrochloum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can be invasive in certain regions.
